text.value:
Based on the provided context, it appears you're encountering a ClassNotFoundException for the main application class. Here are some steps to resolve this issue:
1. Ensure that your project structure follows Maven conventions. The main application class should be in the src/main/java directory under the appropriate package structure.
2. Verify that the com.ironhack.tfd_builds package exists and contains the TfdBuildsApplication class.
3. Check your pom.xml file to make sure the Maven compiler plugin is correctly configured and the source and target Java versions are set appropriately.
4. Run a Maven clean and install to rebuild your project: mvn clean install
5. If using an IDE, refresh your project and rebuild it.
6. Ensure that the main class is correctly specified in your Spring Boot configuration, either in the application.properties file or as a annotation on your main class.
If the issue persists, you may want to double-check your classpath and ensure all dependencies are correctly resolved. The Spring Boot Maven Plugin mentioned in the reference documentation can be helpful for running and packaging your application correctly.
